channel.title: git on bigelectrons
channel.description: Recent content in git on bigelectrons

item.title: Keeping up with Upstream Git Repo
item.description: If you have forked a repository in GitHub that you want to work on, you do so, make your changes locally and once you are confident that everything works, you issue a pull request to the upstream so that your changes can be reviewed and merged. Here is a small snippet that I use to keep my fork up-to-date with the upstream. upstream - The original repository from which you fork
